description: A dark-skinned man in a white robe, seated on a colorful rug, looks up at an Indian soldier in British uniform, who is holding a sword and standing over him. The man's hands are clasped together in a pleading manner, while his eyes are cast down in despair. The background of the painting features ornate architecture, with intricate carvings and archways. The atmosphere is tense and foreboding, with bold brushstrokes used to convey a sense of drama and urgency.

A serene, moonlit night scene featuring a group of weary travelers, mostly women and children, trudging along a dusty path, their faces illuminated only by the soft glow of lanterns and the distant stars above; the figures are depicted in various states of exhaustion, some with heads bowed, others looking up at the celestial bodies for guidance; the atmosphere is one of quiet resilience and determination, with the travelers' worn clothing and meager belongings a testament to their arduous journey; in the background, a hazy silhouette of a distant town or city can be seen, casting a sense of longing and hope on the scene.
